circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
In February of 1981, Bruce Falconer was a newly promoted sergeant in the Marines, which he joined at age 16 with his mother's approval. 
He was home in Bismarck on leave before being transferred to Yuma, Arizona. He spent his time on leave catching up with old friends, including Tim Jewell, his friend since grade school. 
Falconer and Jewell went to a few bars on the night of February 20, 1981, then went in Falconer's Blazer to the "Desert" south of Bismarck along the Missouri River after the bars closed. 
A few days later, Falconer's uncle found Bruce's Blazer stuck at the Desert. Nearby was a campfire and cigarette butts. 
Jewell's body was found in 1992 by a hunter, but Bruce has never been found. The Marines declared him dead five years after his disappearance. The coroner determined Jewell's likely cause of death was exposure.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Pile lined blue jean jacket, tan shirt with a braid trim, white corduroy jeans

physicalDescription.headHairDescription: White Male with Blond Hair, Brown eyes - MARINE on leave

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: 2" Scar above Right Eye
Tattoo of dragon, silver arrowhead necklace

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
On January 7, 2024, Roger Shelton was reported to the Williams County Sheriff's Office as a missing person. Mr. Shelton was last seen on January 5, 2024, at the Black Gold Casino, which is located on the Montana/North Dakota border. 
Mr. Shelton’s personal effects, including his vehicle, wallet, and cell phone, were inside his Williams County, North Dakota residence. 
Mr. Shelton is 61 years old, approximately 5’2”, with brown hair and brown eyes. Mr. Shelton has significant scars on his chest, back, and lower abdominal area. Mr. Shelton has a “Pink Panther” outline tattooed on his upper left arm, with the word “Roach” underneath it.

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Significant scars on his chest, back and lower abdomen
"Pink panther" outline on upper left arm with the word "Roach" under it

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Nikle was last seen by her family in Grand Forks, North Dakota on October 2, 1996. A family friend reported a brief sighting of her a couple of days later. On October 10, 1996, her father contacted local law enforcement authorities in Grand Forks to report Nikle missing. An extensive investigation was conducted but her whereabouts remain unknown.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Craig left Fargo at 2030-2100 hours on 9/17/20 with two unidentified males. He was giving the males a ride to Belcourt, ND, on the Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation. Craig has not been seen or heard from since by friends and family, which it very unusual. He was driving his maroon 1999 Saturn SL with Oregon plate 653KYU, the plate is not registered to Craig. The vehicle was recovered on the Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation on 9/29/20, but Craig remains missing.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Last seen wearing blue jeans and t-shirt

vehicles.comment: Vehicle was recovered at 3851 BIA 10, Belcourt, ND, on the Turtle Mountain Indian Reservation. Vehicle is inoperable.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Joe borrowed a vehicle from a friend on 6/1/13 and was to return it that evening.  The friend reported Joe and his truck missing the following day.  The truck was located on farmland east of Epping/Springbrooke Dam.  His boots and socks were found 200 yards from the vehicle next to the creek.  The creek was searched by a rescue dive team and a sonar robot as well as cadaver dogs and nothing was found.

notes.description: Anyone with information concerning the disappearance of Joe Lee contact the Williston County Sheriff's Office:  701-577-7700.

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Tattoo on back and Left shoulder

vehicles.comment: vehicle was recovered by law enforcement

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Joseph Bruce, Sr. has been missing since 06-25-18.  He last had contact with his girlfriend on the phone on 06-25-18 at about 10:00 AM while he was in Devils Lake, ND.  There has been no activity on his phone since 06-25-18 and he has had no contact with family since then.  He was known to be in Grand Forks, Bellcourt and possibly Spirit Lake prior to going missing.

notes.description: Partial remains were found on 06/09/2019 on the Spirit Lake Reservation.  Case will remain active in NamUs until additional remains can be found.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Always wears a silver chain with dad's ashes around his neck

vehicles.comment: Vehicle was recovered on Ft. Totton reservation by law enforcement

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Michele had dropped her 3 year old son off at his (paternal) grandfather’s home and was going to pick up her paycheck, play bingo, and return to pick up her son. She thought she would be gone only a few hours. She did not return and this was reported the next day at 2140 hrs. Michele never did get her check and she did not play bingo.

vehicles.comment: Turbo Coupe.  Vehicle ws located 6 days after her disappearance.  Vehicle was located at the Comfort Inn north Bismarck.

She did not login to work the following day and nobody has had any contact with her since. She left her house with her dog Scooby (Chihuahua Terrier Mix), her purse, and her 2017 Grey Nissan Rogue. No transactions have occurred on any of her credit cards or bank accounts.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Kenneth was last seen leaving Ralph's Corner Bar in Moorehead, which has since been demolished.

Roy Hagel left Bismarck to attend a bowling tournament in Fargo, ND on February 26, 1989, where he was last seen.  After the tournament, he did not return to Bismarck.  He visited an old friend in Cedar Rapids, IA during the last days of February 1989.  He called the friend on March 6, 1989 from Kingman, AZ, saying that he had been in nine states in nine days, that he was out of money, and going to return to Bismarck. 
 
Hagel’s vehicle was found on March 10, 1989 near Death Valley Monument, parked off the road in a desolate area.  His keys and wallet were on the front seat of the vehicle.  A baseball style cap was found a short ways from the vehicle and a long gun case was located further during the track.  A set of footprints were tracked about six miles into the desert and then lost.  At the time of his disappearance, Hagel sounded depressed when talking to his friend and had hinted at suicide.

physicalDescription.facialHairDescription: No facial hair at the time of his disappeance but at times had a full mustache

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Scar right wrist;  Scar left temple circular half dollar size
Roy Hagel tanned very dark in the summer time and could be mistaken for someone of Hispanic decent

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Kristopher Clarke, nickname K.C., has been missing since Feb. 22, 2012. Kristopher is a native of Washington, but had gone to North Dakota for work. He was last sighted at his job at Blackstone Trucking in New Town, ND.  His truck was found a few months later abandoned in Williston, ND.  In February 2016, James Henrikson was convicted of hiring a man to kill KC.  His body has not been located.

vehicles.comment: Extended cab, diesel, license plate #AC63117 - found in Williston, ND
